segment.source: Add a Windows 10 operating system image using Configuration Manager (Windows 10)
segment.target: Add a Windows 10 operating system image using Configuration Manager (Windows 10)

segment.source: Operating system images are typically the production image used for deployment throughout the organization.
segment.target: Operating system images are typically the production image used for deployment throughout the organization.

segment.source: Add a Windows 10 operating system image using Configuration Manager
segment.target: Add a Windows 10 operating system image using Configuration Manager

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Operating system images are typically the production image used for deployment throughout the organization.
segment.target: Operating system images are typically the production image used for deployment throughout the organization.

segment.source: This topic shows you how to add a Windows 10 operating system image created with Microsoft System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager, and how to distribute the image to a distribution point.
segment.target: This topic shows you how to add a Windows 10 operating system image created with Microsoft System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager, and how to distribute the image to a distribution point.

segment.source: For the purposes of this topic, we will use CM01, a machine running Windows Server 2012 R2 Standard, as the distribution point.
segment.target: For the purposes of this topic, we will use CM01, a machine running Windows Server 2012 R2 Standard, as the distribution point.

segment.source: CM01 is a member of the domain contoso.com for the fictitious Contoso Corporation.
segment.target: CM01 is a member of the domain contoso.com for the fictitious Contoso Corporation.

segment.source: For more details on the setup for this topic, please see Deploy Windows 10 with the Microsoft Deployment Toolkit.
segment.target: For more details on the setup for this topic, please see Deploy Windows 10 with the Microsoft Deployment Toolkit.

segment.source: Our image is named REFW10-X64-001.wim.
segment.target: Our image is named REFW10-X64-001.wim.

segment.source: For details on building this image, please see Create a Windows 10 reference image.
segment.target: For details on building this image, please see Create a Windows 10 reference image.

segment.source: Using File Explorer, in the E:SourcesOSDOS folder, create a subfolder named Windows 10 Enterprise x64 RTM.
segment.target: Using File Explorer, in the E:SourcesOSDOS folder, create a subfolder named Windows 10 Enterprise x64 RTM.

segment.source: Copy the REFW10-X64-001.wim file to the E:SourcesOSDOSWindows 10 Enterprise x64 RTM folder.
segment.target: Copy the REFW10-X64-001.wim file to the E:SourcesOSDOSWindows 10 Enterprise x64 RTM folder.

segment.source: figure 17
segment.target: figure 17

segment.source: Figure 17.
segment.target: Figure 17.

segment.source: The Windows 10 image copied to the Sources folder structure.
segment.target: The Windows 10 image copied to the Sources folder structure.

segment.source: Using the Configuration Manager Console, in the Software Library workspace, right-click Operating System Images, and select Add Operating System Image.
segment.target: Using the Configuration Manager Console, in the Software Library workspace, right-click Operating System Images, and select Add Operating System Image.

segment.source: On the Data Source page, in the Path: text box, browse to CM01Sources$OSDOSWindows 10 Enterprise x64 RTMREFW10-X64-001.wim and click Next.
segment.target: On the Data Source page, in the Path: text box, browse to CM01Sources$OSDOSWindows 10 Enterprise x64 RTMREFW10-X64-001.wim and click Next.

segment.source: On the General page, assign the name Windows 10 Enterprise x64 RTM and click Next twice, and then click Close.
segment.target: On the General page, assign the name Windows 10 Enterprise x64 RTM and click Next twice, and then click Close.

segment.source: Distribute the operating system image to the CM01 distribution point by right-clicking the Windows 10 Enterprise x64 RTM operating system image and selecting Distribute Content.
segment.target: Distribute the operating system image to the CM01 distribution point by right-clicking the Windows 10 Enterprise x64 RTM operating system image and selecting Distribute Content.

segment.source: In the Distribute Content Wizard, add the CM01 distribution point.
segment.target: In the Distribute Content Wizard, add the CM01 distribution point.

segment.source: View the content status for the Windows 10 Enterprise x64 RTM package.
segment.target: View the content status for the Windows 10 Enterprise x64 RTM package.

segment.source: Do not continue until the distribution is completed.
segment.target: Do not continue until the distribution is completed.

segment.source: You also can review the E:Program FilesMicrosoft Configuration ManagerLogsdistmgr.log file and look for the STATMSG: ID=2301 line.
segment.target: You also can review the E:Program FilesMicrosoft Configuration ManagerLogsdistmgr.log file and look for the STATMSG: ID=2301 line.

segment.source: figure 18
segment.target: figure 18

segment.source: Figure 18.
segment.target: Figure 18.

segment.source: The distributed Windows 10 Enterprise x64 RTM package.
segment.target: The distributed Windows 10 Enterprise x64 RTM package.
